binary.name: solve_model
binary.syntax: solve_model [-by by] [-bz bz] [-vx vx] [-tilt tilt] [-kp kp] [-rg96|-psr10|-cs10|-ts18|-ts18_kp] [-nointerp] [-noigrf]

option.od: print the help message and exits.
calculate for the date yyyymmdd.
calculate for the time hr:mn.
calculate the model pattern for the southern hemisphere.
set the Y component of the magnetic field to by [nT].
set the Z component of the magnetic field to by [nT].
set the solar wind velocity to vx [km/s].
set the dipole tilt angle to tilt [degrees].
set the Kp magnetic index to kp.
uses the RG96 statistical model.
uses the PSR10 statistical model (equivalent to the RG05 model.)
uses the CS10 statistical model.
uses the TS18 statistical model [default].
uses the TS18-Kp statistical model.
Do not interpolate coeffiecients, instead use discrete models.
Do not use IGRF model to convert potential to velocities,
instead use constant values.
uses the older AACGM software and coefficients. The default
is to use AACGM-v2.
set the latitudinal step size of the grid to dlat [degrees]. Default is 1 degree.
set the longitudinal step size of the grid to dlon [degrees]. Default is 2 degrees.
use an equal-area grid with cell sizes defined by dlat [degrees]. Default is 1 degree in latitude.

synopsis.p: Calculates the statistical model and writes it to standard output.

description.p: Calculates the statistical model and writes it to standard output.

example.description: Calculates TS18 model vectors and potential on a uniform grid for input solar wind and dipole tilt parameters. The output is written to the file "model.txt".
